summary: "There's actually a large number of software companies that are actually getting to a state of maturity," Smith said.

summary: Brooklyn Nets owner Joseph Tsai envisions arenas still without a lot of fans next season though he expects that to turn around in the ensuing years.

Shepard Smith says he worked nights and weekends for decades, often forgetting about his personal life, to succeed as a journalist. Now, with "The News with Shepard Smith" on CNBC, Smith hopes the show will be "a full-plate newscast" that offers the news of the day and some perspective, that points out the heroes amid the chaos, and tells some good news, too.
headline: Shepard Smith on his success: ‘I never said no. Not to one assignment’

summary: The COVID-19 pandemic seems to have changed everything, but when it comes to emerging markets, the things that matter the most for investors have remained consistent.

summary: "Where I come out as a businessman, I will take the devil I know over the devil I don't know anytime of the week," BET founder Robert Johnson told CNBC.
